member.name: F:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.ClearDrawingTools.NewDataAndTimeRange
member.summary: Drawing Tools are automatically cleared when a new data set is loaded or when a new time range is selected. Zooming in/out does not trigger clearing.

member.name: F:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.ClearDrawingTools.NewData
member.summary: Drawing Tools are cleared only when a completely new data set is loaded from data provider or from a file.

member.name: F:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.ClearDrawingTools.None
member.summary: Drawing Tools are not automatically cleared.

member.name: F:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DataAggregationMode.None
member.summary: No data aggregation, each data record given shown as own candle-stick / data point

member.name: F:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DataAggregationMode.Auto
member.summary: Automatic aggregation by visible range, by day / week / month / year etc.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DataAwareControl.SetProvider(Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DataProvider,Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DataProviders.TradingDataProvider)
member.summary: Changes the used data provider. Affects the search bar and methods such as OpenSymbol().
member.param: If using custom data provider (DataProvider.UserDefined), set the provider here.

member.name: F:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DataFetchStatus.ConnectionError
member.summary: Error in connection to data provider

member.name: T:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DataProvider
member.summary: Trading data provider to be used

member.name: F:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DataProvider.MarketStack
member.summary: Use pre-defined MarketStack service to fetch trading data. If a customer-specific API key should be used, use SetRestApiKey -method to set the key.

member.name: F:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DataProvider.WorldTradingData
member.summary: Use pre-defined WorldTradingData.com service to fetch trading data. If a customer-specific API key should be used, use SetRestApiKey -method to set the key. NOTE: WorldTradingData service is currently offline / not working properly.

member.name: F:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DataProvider.AlphaVantage
member.summary: Use pre-defined AlphaVantage.co service to fetch trading data. If a customer-specific API key should be used, use SetRestApiKey -method to set the key.

member.name: F:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DataProvider.UserDefined
member.summary: Requests trading data from user-defined provider. Prevents automatic calls to pre-defined data providers.

member.summary: Data format of the data set request.

member.name: F:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DataRequestType.Csv

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.AddData(Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.OhlcData[],System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds new data points to the chart. Does not remove or replace the existing data points.
member.param: OHLC and volume data. If it contains gaps of non-trading days, chart removes them automatically

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.AutoClearDrawingTools
member.summary: Gets or sets if all Drawing Tools should be automatically cleared and disposed when new trading data is loaded to the chart.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Begin update. Disables control repaints when a property is changed. Handy when updating status of many properties or setting data of various objects.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.ClearData(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.param: Remove and dispose also all Indicators.
Remove and dispose also all Drawing Tools

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.CopyToClipboard(Arction.Wpf.Charting.ClipboardImageFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copy the chart to clipboard image. Custom size can be defined via width and height parameters.
member.param: Allows screen coordinates of certain elements to be scaled by factor of defined size and original size to keep then in place in relation to other chart elements in vector exports. If unsure, use value true. Should be set to false if annotation tables or such constructs are used. Affects only vector output (emf and svg).

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.DataProvider
member.summary: Controls which trading data provider should be used.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.DataRequestType
member.summary: Set in which data string format (json, csv) the pre-defined provider returns data.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.DateTimeToXValue(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts given DateTime to actual X-axis value. Due to removal of non-trading days, the X-axis is not linear. Therefore, it is not possible to convert values outside the visible time range. Returns minimum or maximum axis value if given time is outside the range.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the chart and all its indicators and drawing tools.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.DisposeAllDrawingTools
member.summary: Removes and disposes all Drawing Tools in the chart.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.DisposeAllIndicators
member.summary: Removes and disposes all Indicators in the chart.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.DrawingTools
member.summary: Drawing tools collection. Add here. e.g. TrendLine drawing tool

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.EndUpdate
member.summary: End update. Enables control repainting, and refreshes the control.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.GetAllRangeButtons
member.summary: Gets list of all time range buttons

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.GetInternalChart
member.summary: Gets a LightningChart instance which this trading chart API is built on. Gives you direct control of the chart, and allows customizing it in further level.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.GetOhlcData
member.summary: Gets the current data set as an Ohlc-data array. Returns the whole loaded data set, not only the current visible time range.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.GetOhlcDataFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Converts CSV formatted data into OHLC data. Expects data in the following column order: Open, Close, High, Low, Volume (Optional), OpenInterest (Optional).
member.param: The path and the name of the file

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.GetTimeRange(System.DateTime@,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Gets the time range of the current data set.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.GetXAxisMinMax(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the actual minimum and maximum double values of the time range X-axis. To get the start/end dates, use GetTimeRange() -method.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.GetYAxisMinMax(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the minimum and maximum values of the price Y-axis.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.Indicators
member.summary: Indicators collection. Add here e.g. Simple Moving Average or Relative Strength Index technical indicators.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.LimitOhlcDataToStackSegment
member.summary: The OHLC data series is clipped outside the main segment, and is not shown on segment indicators.

member.name: E:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.OhlcDataModified
member.summary: Event indicating when new or modified OHLC data has been successfully added to the chart.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.OpenSymbol
member.summary: Opens the security by Symbol. Uses the currently set time range.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.OpenSymbol(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Opens the security by Symbol. Manually define a new time range.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.SaveToFile(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Save the chart into a image file. Custom size can be defined via width and height parameters.
member.param: Target file name. You must include file extension (png, bmp, jpg, tif, gif, wmf, emf, svg).
Width of required output in pixels
Height of required output in pixels

Allows screen coordinates of certain elements to be scaled by factor of defined size and original size to keep then in place in relation to other chart elements in vector exports. If unsure, use value true. Should be set to false if annotation tables or such constructs are used. Affects only vector output (emf and svg).
member.returns: True if the image was successfully written to file. Returns false on invalid file extension, on file write failure and on other problems on image creation or saving.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.SaveToStream(System.IO.Stream,Arction.Wpf.Charting.TargetImageFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Save the chart into stream in given format. Custom size can be defined via width and height parameters.
member.param: Allows screen coordinates of certain elements to be scaled by factor of defined size and original size to keep then in place in relation to other chart elements in vector exports. If unsure, use value true. Should be set to false if annotation tables or such constructs are used. Affects only vector output (emf and svg).

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.SetAppearance(Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.Appearance)
member.summary: Set appearance, such as colors and fonts based. Overrides object colors you might have set explicitly.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.SetData(Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.OhlcData[],System.String,System.String)
member.param: OHLC and volume data. If it contains gaps of non-trading days, chart removes them automatically

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.SetRestApiKey(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the customer-specific rest API key for the data provider. If this is not set, LightningChart's own connection will be used. Call this method only after DataProvider has been set, as changing DataProvider -property resets the current API key.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.SetSecurityInfo(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.param: Symbol of the security. This also changes the Symbol -property used by OpenSymbol method.
Full name of the stock exchange
Country, city etc. in which the exchange is located.
Type of the security e.g. equity
If set true, automatically updates the chart title with the given information

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.SetTimeRange(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Manually set the time range of the loaded data. Can automatically adjust the current data set according to given time range. If no data has been loaded, the next data set loaded from a provider will use this range unless set otherwise.
member.param: DateTime of the first data point
DateTime of the last data point
If set true (default), drops data points outside the visible time range. When false, only changes the X-axis minimum and maximum.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.ShowErrorMessages
member.summary: When enabled, shows error messages above the chart.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.ShowSearchBar
member.summary: Show the search bar for fetching trading data from Internet above the chart.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.ShowSegmentSplitters
member.summary: Show or hide the splitter ConstantLines separating the segments.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.ShowTimeLabels
member.summary: Show the time labels below the chart.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.ShowTimeRangeSelection
member.summary: Show the time range selection bar.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.ShowToolMenu

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.ShowWeekNumbers

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.TrackOhlcData
member.summary: Allows data cursor to track the visible Ohlc-data. When disabled, cursor can still track technical indicators.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.TradingData
member.summary: Trading data loaded to chart. This is a bindable dependency property.

member.name: M:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.ZoomToFit
member.summary: Zoom the data to fit the whole graph. Use ZoomToFitVerticalPadding to leave some empty space above and below the graph.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TradingChart.ZoomToFitVerticalPadding
member.summary: Empty space in pixels left above and below the trading data when calling ZoomToFit() -method. Does not apply to mouse zooming.

member.summary: Base class for all drawing tools

member.summary: Control points collection. Control points provide interactive way to modify drawing tool positioning and orientation.

member.summary: Draws the Drawing Tool based on the given coordinates.

member.name: T:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciArc
member.summary: Draws a trend line between two control points, followed by multiple arcs intersecting the line at levels 38.2%, 50.0%, 61.8% and 100%. The arcs are centered on the second control point.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciArc.FillEnabled
member.summary: Show colored fills between the Fibonacci arcs. If disabled, only the arcs are visible.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciArc.FullCircle
member.summary: Show Fibonacci arcs as full circle.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciArc.LabelColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the labels.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciArc.LabelDistance
member.summary: Label distance to the arc lines in pixels.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciArc.LimitYToStackSegment
member.summary: Arc lines are clipped outside the main segment, and not shown on segment indicators.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciArc.LineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the trend line and the arcs.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciArc.LineWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the trend line and the arcs.

member.name: T:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciFan
member.summary: Draws a trend line between two control points, then several Fibonacci fan lines starting from the first point and crossing an “invisible” vertical line at the X-value of the second point based on Fibonacci levels at 38.2%, 50.0% and 61.8%.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciFan.FillEnabled
member.summary: Show colored fills between the Fibonacci lines. If disabled, only the lines are visible.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciFan.LabelColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the labels.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciFan.LabelDistance
member.summary: Label distance to the Fibonacci lines in pixels.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciFan.LimitYToStackSegment
member.summary: Fan lines are clipped outside the main segment, and not shown on segment indicators.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciFan.LineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the fan lines.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciFan.LineWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the fan lines.

member.name: T:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciRetracement
member.summary: Draws a trend line between two control points, then several horizontal retracement lines based on selected price range(height) of the trendline.The retracement lines are drawn at Fibonacci level of 38.2%, 50.0% and 61.8%.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciRetracement.FillEnabled
member.summary: Show colored fills between the Fibonacci lines. If disabled, only the lines are visible.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciRetracement.LabelColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the labels.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciRetracement.LabelDistance
member.summary: Label distance to the Fibonacci lines in pixels.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciRetracement.LimitYToStackSegment
member.summary: Fibonacci lines are clipped outside the main segment, and not shown on segment indicators.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciRetracement.LineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the trend line and the retracements.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.DrawingTools.FibonacciRetracement.LineWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the line width of the trend line and the retracements.

member.name: T:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.AverageTrueRange
member.summary: Average True Range measures market volatility by calculating the average of true ranges over a given time range. Appears as a segment below the main price chart.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.AverageTrueRange.LimitYToStackSegment
member.summary: Indicator is clipped outside the segment it belongs to.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.AverageTrueRange.LineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the Average True Range line.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.AverageTrueRange.LineWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the Average True Range line.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.AverageTrueRange.PeriodCount
member.summary: The number of time periods in the Average True Range calculation, set to 14 days by default.

member.name: T:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.BollingerBand
member.summary: Bollinger Band® is a technical analysis tool defined by a set of lines plotted typically two standard deviations (up and down) away from a simple moving average (SMA) of the security's price. Many traders believe the closer the prices move to the upper band, the more overbought the market, and the closer the prices move to the lower band, the more oversold the market.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.BollingerBand.BorderLineColor
member.summary: The color of the border of the band

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.BollingerBand.BorderLineWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the border of the band.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.BollingerBand.FillColor
member.summary: The color of the Bollinger Band

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.BollingerBand.NumberOfStandardDeviations
member.summary: Number of Standard Deviations. Upper band is SD * this value above Simple Moving Average line, and Lower band respectively below.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.Indicator.Title
member.summary: Title shown in the data cursor box, and near Y-axes.

member.name: T:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MoneyFlowIndex
member.summary: The Money Flow Index (MFI) uses price and volume data for identifying overbought or oversold signals. It can also be used to spot divergences which warn of a trend change in price. MFI moves between 0 and 100. Unlike many other oscillators such as the Relative Strength Index (RSI), the Money Flow Index incorporates both price and volume data.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MoneyFlowIndex.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the Money Flow Index line.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MoneyFlowIndex.LimitYToStackSegment
member.summary: Indicator is clipped outside the segment it belongs to.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MoneyFlowIndex.LineWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the Money Flow Index line.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MoneyFlowIndex.OverboughtColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the overbought limit.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MoneyFlowIndex.OverboughtRange
member.summary: Overbought range. Values above this are considered overbought. Default value is 80.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MoneyFlowIndex.OversoldColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the oversold limit.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MoneyFlowIndex.OversoldRange
member.summary: Oversold range. Values below this are considered oversold. Default value is 20.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MoneyFlowIndex.PeriodCount
member.summary: The number of time periods in the Money Flow Index calculation, set to 14 days by default.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MovingAverage.Color

member.summary: Indicator is clipped outside the segment it belongs to.

member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the Moving Average line.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MovingAverage.PeriodCount

member.summary: Allow Data Cursor to track this indicator.

member.name: T:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence
member.summary:
Moving Average Convergence Divergence indicator (MACD). Appears below main price chart.
MACD line is the difference between Exponentially weighted Moving Average (EMA) of Short period data, and EMA of Long period data. That is: EMA(price short period) - EMA(price long period).
Signal line is Signal period EMA of MACD.
Histogram shows the difference between MACD and Signal. That is: MACD - Signal.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence.BaseLineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the base line color.

member.summary: Gets or sets the negative strong color for Histogram.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence.HistogramNegativeWeakColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the negative weak color for Histogram.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence.HistogramPositiveStrongColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the positive strong color for Histogram.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence.HistogramPositiveWeakColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the positive weak color for Histogram.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence.LimitYToStackSegment
member.summary: Indicator is clipped outside the segment it belongs to.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence.LongPeriodCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the long period count.

member.summary: Gets or sets the MACD line color.

member.summary: Gets or sets the MACD line width.

member.summary: Gets or sets the short period count.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Signal line color.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Signal line width.

member.summary: Gets or sets the period count for Signal.

member.name: T:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.OpenInterest
member.summary: Open interest is the total number of outstanding derivative contracts, such as options or futures that have not been settled for an asset. The total open interest does not count, nor does total of every buy and sell contract. Instead, open interest provides a more accurate picture of the options trading activity, and whether money flows into the futures and options market are increasing or decreasing. Shows as a little chart with a line below main price chart.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.OpenInterest.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the Open Interest line.

member.summary: Indicator is clipped outside the segment it belongs to.

member.name: P:Arction.CustomControls.Trader.WPF.TechnicalIndicators.OpenInterest.LineWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the Open Interest line.
